message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you the opportunity to purchase this product.  Given its value, I'm initially proposing a price of $13,000.  I believe this is a fair starting point, but I'm open to discussing further.

I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I've done some research and I believe the product is worth less than you think. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I can only go up to $11,000. I'm hoping we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, $11,000 undervalues the product significantly.  I'm confident this product can bring you a substantial return on your investment. How about we meet in the middle at $12,000?

I understand that you're confident in the product's value, but I still think $9,500 is a fair price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to make sure I'm getting a good deal. How about we meet at $10,500?

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm afraid we're too far apart on price.  $10,500 is really cutting it close to my bottom line.  I'm willing to make one last offer at $11,500. This is a very generous offer considering the product's value.

I appreciate your willingness to make one last offer, Alice, but I'm afraid $11,500 is still too high for me. I'm willing to make a serious offer of $9,000, which is the lowest I'm willing to go. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle one last time.
